title: Bard is the best designed champion in this game.
body:
Obviously the title is my opinion, but having played league for 6 years i think bard is the most on-point champion to be released.

Bard is a champion that has really strong high points and overall utility, unique playstyle, and clear weaknesses. It is very rewarding to learn the champion but at the same time he isn't frustrating to play against if you're playing against someone with a lot of experience on him.

Kudos to whoever made this champ honestly.

See I have  been playing since Beta and couldn't disagree more.

Bard is situational and often provides the least amount of damage of all support champions.

Situational you say.... yes  situational, because even the best Bards use their ult resulting in a bad outcome.  And if there is even 1:10 times you Gold incorrect in what very much seems like a clunky ult you just screwed your team.  

You see the problem?  Potential to ruin the team encounter and the least amount of damage of the support champions.

Karma is a much better pick.  Why?  High damage potential and AoE/mobility shielding.    Even single target shields offer that much more. 

Now we could go down the avenues that... Bard has a heal and a magical journey... but his heals are low and misplaced journey causes death more than escapes.  (You never hear about a misplaced shielding/movement causing death.)

When facing a team fight I much rather have a burst of speed/mobility and a shielding on all team members than a gold that doesn't last nearly long enough, misses or worse loses us the team fight.

Lastly the champion reminds me of the male version of Lux when she came out.  Very unappealing and badly modeled.
